{"step_by_step_thinking": "Gingival hyperplasia, or the overgrowth of gum tissue, can be caused by certain medications. Sodium valproate, carbamazepine, and verapamil are all known to potentially cause this condition. However, bleomycin, a chemotherapy drug, is not associated with gingival hyperplasia.", "answer_choice": "D. Bleomycin"}
